qas.question: Who Published A Theory of Justice?
When was A Theory of Justice published?
Who wrote Anarchy, State, and Utopia?
What did Robert Nozick write in 1971?
What did John Rawls write in 1974?
What award did John Rawls's book win?
What is Robert Nozick's book considered in American philosophy?
What viewpoint did John Rawls have when responding to Rober Nozick?

context: In Anglo-American academic political philosophy, the publication of <a1_0>John Rawls<a1_0/>'s <a0_0><b4_0>A Theory of Justice<b4_0/><a0_0/> in <a2_0>1971<a2_0/> is considered <b7_0>a milestone<b7_0/>. Rawls used a thought experiment, the original position, in which representative parties choose principles of justice for the basic structure of society from behind a veil of ignorance. Rawls also offered a criticism of utilitarian approaches to questions of political justice. <a3_0>Robert Nozick<a3_0/>'s 1974 book <b5_0>Anarchy, State, and Utopia<b5_0/>, which won <b6_0>a National Book Award<b6_0/>, responded to Rawls from <b8_0>a libertarian perspective<b8_0/> and gained academic respectability for libertarian viewpoints.
